newsitem.title: LEBANON: MOST BANK SHARES UP IN HEAVY BEIRUT TRADE.
newsitem.headline: MOST BANK SHARES UP IN HEAVY BEIRUT TRADE.

text.p: Bank of Beirut rose to $3.625 on Tuesday from $3.5 and dealers said a 29.61 percent rise in the bank's net profits in the first quarter of 1997 is expected to sustain high demand for the share.
"It is a positive sign. It justifies BOB's current price level and should sustain demand for the share," Broker-analyst Johnny Yacoub of Financial Funds Advisors said.
BOB said on Monday that its unaudited net profits rose 29.61 percent to $1,593,000 in the first three months of 1997 from $1,229,000 at the end of the first quarter of 1996.
Total BSE turnover more than doubled on Tuesday to 915,701 shares against Monday's 451,342. Value rose to $5,610,320 from $2,656,960.
Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce continued a price rally reaching $15.625 from $15.5 a day earlier while Banque Audi traded at $20 for the fourth day.
The LIBX bank index rose 1.45 percent to 135.72 percent. The BLOM general index fell 0.29 percent to 911.50 and the LISPI fell 0.26 percent to 86.95.

"The LISPI was down despite great interest in the bank shares because of a 4.6 percent decrease in Eternit and a 2.4 percent decrease in Ciments Libanais shares," Alain Balian, deputy manager at Beirut finance house Lebanon Invest said.
Demand for BOB was 1,152,566 from Monday's 1,207,095. Supply was 629,606 shares, all of which were sold. Monday's turnover was 253,372.
Demand for BLC totalled 46,012 against a supply of 41,512. Turnover was 24,012 shares. Demand for Audi was 55,138 shares against 28,468 shares in supply, all of which were sold.
"The excessive demand for BOB in the first stages of listing signified the high demand for bank shares," Yacoub said.
"Demand on Audi is still very strong, indicating an upward trend that will be maintained in the long run," he added.
BOB, BLC and Banque Audi have jumped 67 percent, 39 percent and 33 percent respectively since they made their debuts on April 11, December 30 and January 20.
A block of 10,000 BOB shares traded on the floor at $3.687 while a block of 42,500 Audi shares traded at $20 on the exchange.

Eternit fell to $1.9375 from $2.0312 on turnover of 44,500 shares from 10,000 shares a day earlier. Ciments Libanais was also down at $1.25 from $1.2812 on turnover of 500 shares againt Monday's 20,000 shares.
Solidere A and B shares were unchanged at $10.25 and $10.75 respectively.
There was no trade in Ciments Blancs and Uniceramic.
